title: UVU soccer: Utah Valley's Anderson named WAC Offensive Player of the Week
text:
Published: Monday, Oct. 19 2015 3:25 p.m. MDT Updated: 51 minutes ago Utah Valley's Kasandra Anderson (right) moves the ball between defenders. Anderson was named the WAC's Offensive Player of the Week for her play last week in a pair of wins over Grand Canyon and CSU Bakersfield. August Miller, UVU Marketing & Communications Enlarge photoÂ» Summary 
Utah Valley University's Kasandra Anderson has been named the Western Athletic Conference Women's Soccer Offensive Player of the Week for her play Oct. 12-18. Missouri-Kansas City's Anna Lillig earned the WAC's Defensive Player of the Week honor. 
Utah Valley University's Kasandra Anderson has been named the Western Athletic Conference Women's Soccer Offensive Player of the Week for her play Oct. 12-18. Missouri-Kansas City's Anna Lillig earned the WAC's Defensive Player of the Week honor. 
"This is a great honor for Kasandra," Utah Valley head coach Brent Anderson said. "I'm very proud of her and the way she has been performing. She loves the game and thrives on the competition. She brings her very best every day and we know we can count on her at game time." 
Anderson, a senior midfielder from Nibley, Utah (Iowa Western CC), tallied two goals and an assist for five points this past weekend as she led the Wolverines to a pair of wins over Grand Canyon and CSU Bakersfield. The senior midfielder scored the first goal of the game against GCU and then assisted on the game-winning score in the victory over the Lopes. She then scored the game-winning goal in a 3-2 win over CSU Bakersfield on Sunday. With the win, UVU closed out its home slate with an unbeaten 9-0-1 record and the Wolverines remained atop the WAC standings with three games remaining. 
Lillig earned two wins on the weekend in goal to move her season record to 3-1-0. In Friday's match against UTRGV, Lillig made four saves, including three in the second half, to post her first-career clean sheet and the 'Roos sixth shutout of the season. Lillig allowed one goal in Sunday's match against NM State but stopped another four shots to bring her weekend total to eight, giving her an .815 save percentage on the weekend. 
Utah Valley continues WAC play this week as the Wolverines travel to play Grand Canyon on Friday at 6 p.m. MT, and CSU Bakersfield on Sunday at 12 p.m. MT. 
Other offensive nominees included: Chicago State freshman midfielder Amber Jones who scored her first collegiate goal against NM State, Missouri-Kansas City sophomore forward Kara Priest who assisted on the game-winning goal vs. UTRGV and scored a goal and added an assist against NM State as the 'Roos went 2-0 on the weekend, NM State freshman forward Sabrina Ruiz who scored two goals in two games for the Aggies, Seattle U senior forward Julia Moravec who scored five points on the week, highlighted by a two-goal effort in the Redhawks' victory over CSU Bakersfield and UT Rio Grande Valley sophomore midfielder Marcela Ramirez who had a career-high six shots and scored a goal vs. Chicago State. 
Other defensive nominees included: Chicago State freshman goalkeeper Audra Wisehart who made 17 saves vs. NM State, just one short of tying the WAC all-time record for saves in a match, Seattle U senior defender Kelly Beck who led a backline that shut out CSU Bakersfield and added a goal in the Redhawks' victory over Grand Canyon, UT Rio Grande Valley freshman defender Tuva Nilsen who was part of a defense that shutout Chicago State, allowing just one shot in the match and Utah Valley junior defender Abby Jameson who led a Utah Valley defense that gave up three goals in two wins on the weekend.
